ltl2rabin.LTL

Class PropEquivalenceClass

  • Object
    • ltl2rabin.LTL.PropEquivalenceClass

  • public class PropEquivalenceClass
extends Object
    An object of this class represents an equivalence class of LTL formulas. This class solves several problems: - It separates the BDD library from the rest of the code - It eliminates formulas that are propositionally equivalent - It serves as a point where all variables and their BDD representations get stored

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PropEquivalenceClass.BlackHole
      This class serves as a callback class for the output of the bddFactory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropEquivalenceClass

        public PropEquivalenceClass(Formula representative)
        A PropEquivalenceClass wraps a Formula into a propositional equivalence class. Two propositional equivalence classes are considered equal if their representatives are propositionally equivalent.
        Parameters:
        representative - The formula that represents the class. For example, "a & b" can serve as a representative for "a & b & a", "b & a", "a & b | ff", ... since they all are propositionally equivalent.

    • Method Detail

      • getRepresentative

        public Formula getRepresentative()
        Returns:
        The representative used to create this PropEquivalenceClass

      • implies

        public boolean implies(PropEquivalenceClass other)
        Parameters:
        other - The PropEquivalenceClass this is compared to
        Returns:
        true, if this propositionally implies other

      • isTautology

        public boolean isTautology()
        Returns:
        true, if the propositional equivalence class contains true. For example, "a | tt" is a tautology.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • suppressBDDOutput

        public static void suppressBDDOutput()
        Call this method if you don't want to see any output by the BDD library. Usually, this information only is of value for a developer, not an end user.
